1. This road sign means the road you're driving on:
column6: turns to the right and then the left
column8: turns sharply to the left and then right

3. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column6: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column8: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.

column2: 4. When the traffic light is green, but traffic is blocking the intersection, drivers should:
column4: enter the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.
column6: honk their horn to establish their right-of-way.
column8: not enter the intersection until they can get completely across.

column2: 5. Motorcycles:
column4: are easier to see than cars.
column6: must share a traffic lane with another vehicle.
column8: are entitled to use a complete traffic lane.

column2: 6. Drivers under the age of 21 are subject to a specific restriction prohibiting them from driving:
7. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Do not drive if you are very weary.

column2: 8. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?

10. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column6: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.
column8: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 11. When passing another car, you have enough room to return to the driving lane when:
column4: you can see both headlights of the car you passed in your rearview mirror.
column6: you are at least 50 feet in front of the vehicle.
column8: you cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.

column2: 12. Who is most at risk?
column6: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 13. In work zones, barriers such as drums, panels and cones are used to:
column4: keep traffic out of hazardous work zones.
column8: keep workers out of the work zone.

column2: 14. A driver who's being passed on the right and the left by many vehicles while driving in the center lane of an highway should:
column6: move to the lane on their right.
column8: move to the lane on their left.

20. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
21. At an intersection without stop or yield signs, you should:
column4: wait until there are no vehicles at the intersection.
column6: yield to the vehicle to your left.
column8: yield to the vehicle to your right.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column8: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 23. As your speed increases it is most important to:
column6: drive with both hands on steering wheel.

column2: 24. Drivers may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if:
column4: the vehicle ahead moves to the right to let them pass.
column6: the yellow line next to their side of the road is broken.
column8: the yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken.
